subject: Welcome to YAPC::NA
header: ... the lucky ones who could make it to the conference that starts today. Including Yanick. Enjoy!
the others, who could not make it this year, like myself, there are a bunch of videos of presentation from the previous year at the <a href="http://perltv.org/

entries.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
entries.text: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

chapters.title: GitTip profile of the week
chapters.header: GitTip allows you to give a regular weekly monetary gift to people in order to encourage them to do more of the awesome stuff they have been doing. The gifts can be as low as 1 cent a week. In this section every week you will see a different Perl developer we recommend you support. Oh, and the Perl Weekly itself also has a GitTip account.

entries.title: CPAN Testers Summary - May 2014 - American Beauty
System Sleuthing - Using ptrace to Print Backtraces
entries.text: Rob Hoelz introduces Devel::Trace::Syscall. It uses ptrace to figure out when a system call is made.

entries.title: The camel survives!
entries.text: Installing Perl in hostile environments. For example on a Centos 6 Linux box. Without a cpan client

entries.title: Acme::Buffalo::Buffalo
entries.text: The Perl Gerl has released her first CPAN module. I don't know if we can take her seriously.

entries.title: Perl TV over 300 videos
entries.text: See a few picks for this week, just below.

entries.title: Digest::SHA is broken
entries.text: 24 min talk by Mark Overmeer at the Nederlandese Perl Workshop

entries.title: Network Mockery
entries.text: Jason Clifford introduces Mock::LWP::Request in 3 minutes at the London Perl Workshop

entries.title: Questhub A Social Todo List for your Perl Projects
entries.text: Neil Bowers spreads his love of Questhub at the London Perl Workshop in just 5 minutes.

entries.title: A Productivity Enhancing Perl Environment
entries.url: Paul Johnson gives lots of ideas ot to set up a work-environment. Starting from the desk and all the way to a number of vim-plugins. (London Perl Workshop - 25 min)

entries.title: Building Convos, a modern IRC client for your browser
entries.text: Marcus Ramberg talks about Mojolicious and HTML5 Web Technologies like Web Sockets, Desktop Notifications, Media Queries, and Push State. (Mojoconf - 25 min)

entries.title: Boxes and pebbles
entries.text: A math problem solved by Carl Mäsak using Perl 6

entries.title: 2014.24: Inlining, some more JIT, a bit of gtk and cairo.

entries.text: In the following cities: Granada (ES), Sofia (BG), Tokyo (JP), Flörli Olten (CH), Salzburg (AT)
